results.title: What's the difference!
results.creator_credit: Sally Abbott-Smith, Priscilla M. Clarke, Maude Media and Free Kindergarten Union Multicultural Resource Centre
results.brief_description: Examines the role of multicultural education in early childhood development programs. Explains that multicultural education is nesessary for all children and that it should be an overall agenda, incorporated into all aspects of early childhood development education.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sally Abbott-Smith, Priscilla M. Clarke, Maude Media and Free Kindergarten Union Multicultural Resource Centre

results.title: What's in a play: dramatic action
results.creator_credit: James Stinson and Film Associates of California
results.brief_description: Analyses dramatic action, a basic element of all plays, and illustrates it through the use of simple drama - a conflict between a salesman and a customer. Understanding dramatic action can help the student to analyse the structure of any play, and enchance their enjoyment of it.

results.title: Tony Allcock's art of bowls: putting it all together
results.creator_credit: David Hall, Mickey Shepherd and Pedigree Films
results.brief_description: Tony Allcock, British and international indoors and outdoors bowls champion since 1976, explains and demonstrates the basics of lawn bowls which, in his opnion, is all about line, length and luck. Dispelling the myth that bowls is a game for the “oldies”, Tony is assisted by his much younger colleague, Andrew Wills, who represents the growing interest by young people in this game of skill and patience. Forward swing, backward swing, estimating line and length correctly, use of body weight and movement, judging the pace of the green and speed of follow through are all examined in great depth. To demonstrate the various techniques, the pair then play two ends - a short jack and a long jack. This step by step guide all takes place in an indoor bowls club.

results.title: Tonight and every night
results.brief_description: Rita Hayworth stars as Rosalind Bruce, a charismatic entertainer who, along with her showgirl colleagues, attempts to bring light relief from the ravages of war torn Britain. Romance develops between Rosalind and an RAF pilot Paul (Lee Bowman), who she meets during an air raid. Their relationship forms a delightful backdrop to the many entertaining musical numbers. Cast includes Janet Blair, Marc Platt, Leslie Brooks and Shelley Winters. Based on a play by Leslie Storm.

results.title: Goldeneye (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Martin Campbell, Barbara Broccoli, Michael G. Wilson, United Artists Corporation and Danjaq
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
Pierce Brosnan ignites the screen as the legendary James Bond in this explosive, thrill-packed adventure that hits the bulls-eye for nonstop excitement. When a deadly satellite weapon system falls into the wrong hands, only agent 007 can save the world from certain disaster. Cast includes Sean Bean, Izabella Scorupco and Famke Janssen.

results.title: Tone, Touch and Technique for the Young Pianist
results.creator_credit: University of Melbourne and Television Production Unit Centre for the Study of Higher Education
results.brief_description: Max Cooke brings to life the theories of posture, gesture and co-ordination, which lead to ease and beauty in piano playing. Explanations about muscular control, finger action, the role of the arms and sense of touch lead directly to exercises for specific aspects of performance, and these in their turn lead to the application of the skills acquired in actual music examples.
results.title_for_label: Tone, Touch and Technique for the Young Pianist

results.title: Tomorrow winter comes
results.creator_credit: Therese Dumesnil, Francois Seguillon, Marc Beaudet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: More and more skiers are opting for cross-country skiing rather than schussing down the crowded, and costlier, maintained slopes. This film captures the full pleasure and delight of this more relaxed but equally invigorating winter sport. A small group of skiers is observed on a day’s outing and, as they glide along through quiet Laurentian woodlands, the film notes techniques of movement. Tips are also given on proper clothing and on ski maintenance. In French with English subtitles. (Award: La Baule.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Therese Dumesnil, Francois Seguillon, Marc Beaudet and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Young ones
results.creator_credit: Sidney J. Furie, Kenneth Harper and Associated British Picture Corporation
results.brief_description: The 1960’s saw a proliferation of teenage dance music films from both the United Kingdom and United States when Elvis and Beatlemania were at their height. Cliff Richard’s film “The Young ones” is a prime example of this genre, and was the first film to have three hits in the Top Ten of the charts. Convinced that a club for teenagers is really a den of Beatnik iniquity, a property tycoon makes preparations to tear it down. Cliff and his friends stage a teen musical to try and save the club and prove that good clean fun and dancing is all they want. Co-starring Robert Morley, Carole Gray and the talented band The Shadows.

results.title: The Yellow leaf
results.creator_credit: Fergus McDonell, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A sympathetic study of an elderly widow, forced to leave her daughter’s household to live in a home for the aged. Shocked and disappointed at first, she overcomes her dejection when she fined that her new home offers congenial friends, new interests and a measure of independence she had not had before.

results.title: Tomorrow is maybe
results.creator_credit: Michael Halvajian and KRMA-TV (Television station : Denver, Colo.)
results.brief_description: Examines man’s dilemma of how to behave toward his environment. Is modern urban life, with its artificiality and ugly trappings of pollution and untrammelled usage of nature’s commodities, an instinctive protection against the alien silence and solitude of the wilderness? Narrated by Ben Aviary.
